meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sulky.
meanings.sent1: Her sulkiness was evident when she refused to speak to anyone.
meanings.sent2: His sulkiness made it hard for others to approach him.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sulkiness at not getting its favorite treat was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky matched the sulkiness of his mood.
meanings.sent5: The sulkiness in the room was palpable, casting a gloomy atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The child's sulkiness after losing the game was hard to miss.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't shake off her sulkiness even after her friends tried to cheer her up.
meanings.sent3: His sulkiness at having to do chores was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The sulkiness in her voice was a clear indicator of her bad mood.
meanings.sent5: The sulkiness in his expression darkened the room with negativity.
